articles.title: India Launches Advanced 5G Network Across Major Cities - Updated 2025
articles.description: Telecom giants Jio and Airtel have successfully rolled out 5G services in Mumbai, Delhi, Bangalore, and Chennai. The new network promises speeds up to 10 times faster than 4G, revolutionizing mobile connectivity across India.

articles.title: Indian Startup Develops AI-Powered Agriculture Solution
articles.description: Bangalore-based startup CropTech has created an AI system that helps farmers predict crop yields and detect diseases early. The solution has already been adopted by over 50,000 farmers across Karnataka and Maharashtra.

articles.title: ISRO Successfully Tests Reusable Launch Vehicle
articles.description: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has successfully completed the third test of its Reusable Launch Vehicle (RLV), bringing India closer to affordable space missions. The test was conducted at the Sriharikota spaceport.

articles.title: India Wins Cricket World Cup in Thrilling Final
articles.description: Team India defeated Australia by 6 wickets in a nail-biting final at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. Virat Kohli's century and Jasprit Bumrah's 4-wicket haul led India to victory in front of 130,000 fans.

articles.title: Neeraj Chopra Breaks World Record in Javelin Throw
articles.description: Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra has set a new world record with a throw of 93.07 meters at the Diamond League meet in Zurich. This achievement makes him the first Indian to hold a world record in athletics.

articles.title: Indian Women's Hockey Team Qualifies for Olympics
articles.description: The Indian women's hockey team has secured their spot in the Paris Olympics after defeating China 3-1 in the final qualifier match. Captain Savita Punia's brilliant goalkeeping was instrumental in the victory.

articles.title: Bollywood Film 'Jawan' Crosses ₹1000 Crore Worldwide
articles.description: Shah Rukh Khan's latest blockbuster 'Jawan' has become the highest-grossing Indian film of all time, crossing the ₹1000 crore mark globally within just 3 weeks of release. The action thriller has broken multiple box office records.

articles.title: AR Rahman to Compose Music for Hollywood Epic
articles.description: Oscar-winning composer AR Rahman has been signed to create the soundtrack for a major Hollywood historical epic. This marks his biggest international project since 'Slumdog Millionaire' and will feature a 100-piece orchestra.

articles.title: Indian Web Series Wins International Emmy Award
articles.description: The critically acclaimed series 'Delhi Crime' has won the International Emmy Award for Best Drama Series. The show, based on true events, has been praised for its powerful storytelling and exceptional performances.

articles.title: India Launches National Digital Health Mission
articles.description: The government has launched a comprehensive digital health platform that will provide every citizen with a unique health ID. The system will store medical records, enable telemedicine, and streamline healthcare delivery across the country.

articles.title: AIIMS Develops Breakthrough Cancer Treatment
articles.description: Researchers at AIIMS Delhi have developed a new immunotherapy treatment that shows 85% success rate in treating advanced lung cancer. The treatment uses modified immune cells and is significantly more affordable than existing therapies.

articles.title: Yoga and Ayurveda Recognized by WHO
articles.description: The World Health Organization has officially recognized traditional Indian practices of Yoga and Ayurveda as effective complementary healthcare systems. India's Ministry of AYUSH celebrates this global acknowledgment of ancient wellness practices.

articles.title: Parliament Passes Historic Women's Reservation Bill
articles.description: The Indian Parliament has unanimously passed the Women's Reservation Bill, reserving 33% of seats in Lok Sabha and state assemblies for women. This landmark legislation is being hailed as a major step towards gender equality in Indian politics.

articles.title: India Assumes G20 Presidency with Focus on Climate
articles.description: India has officially taken over the G20 presidency with a strong emphasis on climate action, sustainable development, and digital transformation. Prime Minister announced ambitious goals for renewable energy and green hydrogen production.

articles.title: New Education Policy Shows Promising Results
articles.description: Two years after implementation, India's National Education Policy 2020 is showing positive outcomes with improved learning outcomes, increased enrollment in vocational courses, and better integration of technology in classrooms across 28 states.

articles.title: Indian Scientists Develop Low-Cost Water Purification System
articles.description: IIT Madras researchers have invented a solar-powered water purification device that costs only ₹2000 and can provide clean drinking water to rural communities. The innovation uses nanotechnology and has already been deployed in 500 villages.

articles.title: Bengaluru Startup Creates Biodegradable Plastic Alternative
articles.description: A Bengaluru-based startup has developed a completely biodegradable alternative to plastic made from agricultural waste. The material decomposes within 90 days and is already being used by major FMCG companies for packaging.

articles.title: Indian Engineer Invents Affordable Prosthetic Limb
articles.description: A Chennai-based engineer has designed a 3D-printed prosthetic limb that costs only ₹5000, making it accessible to millions of Indians. The device uses AI to adapt to the user's movements and has won international recognition.

articles.title: India's GDP Growth Surpasses Expectations at 7.8%
articles.description: India's economy has grown at 7.8% in the last quarter, exceeding all predictions and making it the fastest-growing major economy in the world. Strong performance in manufacturing, services, and digital sectors drove the growth.

articles.title: Mumbai Metro Expansion Connects 15 New Stations
articles.description: The Mumbai Metro has inaugurated 15 new stations across the city, significantly improving connectivity and reducing travel time for millions of commuters. The expansion includes underground and elevated corridors covering 45 kilometers.
